Twigs 2-5 mm diam. Androecium short, often ± club-shaped or ellipsoid(-oblong), 1.5-3(-3.5) mm long.
Leaves blackish; lower leaf surface with minute ± interwoven hairs, sometimes glabrescent. — Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo.
Leaves drying slightly olivaceous; lower leaf surface with minute scattered hairs. — Philippines.
Buds 6-6.5 mm long. — Philippines.
Buds 3-4(-4.5) mm long.

Twigs and inflorescences often drying yellowish, the leaves greenish yellow or olivaceous, papillose below. [Buds cleft c. l/2(-2/3). Androecium ± ellipsoid, androphore pubescent. Fruits with persistent scurfy short indumentum.] — Borneo.
Twigs and inflorescences drying brownish, the leaves (olivaceous-)brown.
Androecium cylindrical or ellipsoid, androphore pubescent. Inflorescences 3-6 cm long. — Philippines (incl. Palawan).
Androecium ± club-shaped, androphore glabrous. Inflorescences more than 6 cm long.
Midrib and lateral nerves on lower leaf side yellowish. [Fruits with grey-brown indumentum.] — Philippines (excl. Palawan).
Midrib and lateral nerves on lower leaf side dark purplish or reddish, contrasting with greyish surface. [Fruits with rusty or orange-brown indumentum.] — Philippines (Palawan, Mindoro).

Inflorescences 7-10 cm long; buds 3-3.5 mm long, cleft 1/4-1/3; androecium without sterile apex, androphore short or absent. [Fruits glabrous or largely nearly so.] — Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo.
Inflorescences 10-15 cm long; buds 4(-4.5) mm long, cleft nearly 2/3; sterile apex of androecium ± blunt, 0.2-0.3 mm long; androphore distinct. [Fruits scurfy.] — Borneo.

Buds 7-8 mm long. Leaves below seemingly glabrous, but actually with scattered minute scale-like hairs less than 0.1 mm (lens!). [Inflorescences usually unbranched. Fruits subglobose or broadly ovoid, 3-4.5 cm long, with persistent scurf of hairs 0.1 mm or less.] — An inland species of C & E Java. (Compare also M. crassa).
Buds 7 mm long or less. Leaves below glabrous (early glabrescent).
Twigs 1.5—3(—3.5) mm diam. Lateral nerves above sunken, distinct. Peduncle 2-40 mm long, the central branch present. Buds 4-6(-7) mm long, pubescent or glabrescent. Fruits 3.5-8.5 cm long.

Twigs 1-2 mm diam. Leaves papillose below (lens!), lateral nerves indistinct above. Inflorescences almost unbranched, peduncle 4-10 mm, flowers in a subumbel. Buds 5 mm long, glabrescent. Fruits 3.5-4 cm long. — Philippines (Palawan).

Leaves (15-)20-35 cm long, drying dull greyish (olivaceous) brown, not papillose. Lateral nerves below flat or but slightly raised. Buds 5 mm long; androecium 3-3.5 mm long, androphore glabrous. [Fruits 5.5-8.5 cm long, pericarp (5-) 10-15 mm thick.] — Sumatra (doubtful), Peninsular Malaysia, Sabah
Leaves smaller, 7-24 cm long, olivaceous. Lateral nerves raised below. Androphore pubescent.
Leaf apex acute-acuminate, lower surface not papillose. Buds 4-6(-7) mm long, (late) glabrescent; androecium 3-6 mm long. Fruits 3-6(-8) cm long, pericarp 3-10 mm thick. — Thailand to Borneo.

Leaf apex blunt to acute (in leaves of sterile sapling shoots acute-acuminate), lower surface papillose. Buds 4-4.5 mm long, with persistent indumentum; androecium 3.5 mm long. Fruits 5-8 cm long, pericarp 15-20 mm thick. — Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo.

Leaves membranous, chartaceous, or subcoriaceous, 7-24 cm long. Female inflorescences or infructescences with peduncle to 1 cm long. Fruits 4-6(-8) cm long, pericarp 4-10 mm thick, late or early glabrescent. Buds 4-6(-7) mm long.
Leaves thinly membranous, 7-14 cm long. Peduncle of female inflorescences or infructescences slender, 1-2.5 cm long. Fruits 3-4 cm long, early glabrescent; peri-cap 3-4 mm thick. Buds 3 mm long.

Twigs 1.5-2(-2.5) mm diam. Leaves 7—12(—15) cm long, apex subacute or rounded; lateral nerves 10—15(—18) per side. Buds 4-4.5 mm long; synandrium without sterile apex. Fruits 5-8 cm long, late glabrescent, at first with scurfy hairs 0.2-0.3 mm. — Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo.

Twigs generally thicker; leaves larger, the apex acute-acuminate, lateral nerves 13-18 per side or more. Synandrium with small sterile apex. Fruits pubescent or glabrescent, with hairs 0.2 mm or more.
Twigs (1.5-)2-4 mm diam. Leaves membranous or thinly coriaceous. Buds 4-7 mm long. [Sterile apex of synandrium present, acute or ± blunt, entire.] Fruits glabrous or early glabrescent.
Twigs 3-6 mm diam. Leaves chartaceous or coriaceous. Buds variable. Fruits glabrous or with persistent indumentum, rarely late glabrescent.
Twigs 1.5-3 mm diam. Leaves membranous, the lower surface not papillose. Buds 4-6(-7) mm long. Fruits (3.5-)4-6(-8) cm long. — Stout form; mainly from NE Borneo.

Twigs (2-)2.5-4 mm diam. Leaves chartaceous or thinly coriaceous, lower surface distinctly papillose. Buds 6-7 mm long. Fruits 7-9 cm long, glabrescent, at first with scurfy hairs 0.5 mm. — Peninsular Thailand, Peninsular Malaysia.

Leaves coriaceous, papillose below. Flowers pubescent with hairs 0.5-1 mm; buds 4-4.5 mm long; sterile apex of synandrium ± lobed. Fruits with conspicuous shaggy hairs 1-2 mm. — Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo.
Leaves chartaceous or coriaceous. Flowers with hairs 0.3-0.5 mm; buds 5 mm long or more; sterile apex of synandrium not lobed. Fruits glabrous or with scurfy hairs 0.5 mm.
Buds 5-5.5 mm long. Bark of leafy twigs early cracking. Leaves not papillose below. Fruits glabrous (early glabrescent). — Borneo.
Buds (5-)6-8 mm long. Bark of twigs late cracking. Leaves papillose or not. Fruits with scurfy indumentum or late glabrescent. — Philippines.

Twigs (4-)5-8 mm diam. Leaves large, 16-40 cm long; lateral nerves 23-33 per side. [Lower leaf surface with persistent indumentum or glabrescent; hairs ± scattered, minute, scale-like, 0.1 (-0.2) mm or less.] Inflorescences stout, 6—12(—18) cm long. Fruits 6-9 cm long, with scurfy hairs 0.1 mm or less, sometimes late glabrescent. — Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo.
Twigs 5 mm diameter or less. Leaves generally smaller with fewer pairs of lateral nerves. Male inflorescences shorter. Fruits of various sizes.

Leaf bud and young twig apex with hairs 0.1 mm. Lower leaf surface densely pubescent with scale-like hairs 0.1 (-0.2) mm (old leaves sometimes glabrescent). Buds cylindrical or slightly contracted in the middle; apical part of bud ± angled; sterile apex of synandrium ± blunt or subacute, usually finely pubescent (glabrous in Sumatra). [Fruits 5-9 cm long, minutely scurfy.] — Peninsular Malaysia to Philippines.

Leaf bud, twig apex, and lower leaf surface with hairs short or long, 0.1 mm or much longer. Buds ± ellipsoid, apical part not angled; apex of synandrium ± flat or shallowly hollowed, the excavation concealed by the somewhat incurved apices of the anthers or not.

Twigs 1.5-3 mm diam. Leaf bud and twig apex with hairs 0.1 mm. Buds 3-4 mm long; androecium 1.5-2.5 mm long; anthers 6-8(-10). Fruits with hairs 0.1 mm or less, sometimes glabrescent. — Not generally a coastal species.

Twigs 3-5(-10) mm diam. Leaf bud and twig apex with conspicuous hairs (0.1-) 0.2-0.5(-l) mm. Buds larger, 4-7 mm, androecium larger, anthers 8-12. Fruits 2.5-4.5 cm long, with more conspicuous persistent hairs 0.5-1 (-2) mm. — Generally a coastal species; Burma, east to Bali and Philippines
Androecium 1.5 mm long. Lateral nerves 45-80° to the midrib. Fruits 5-7 cm long, with dense scurfy indumentum. — Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo.
Androecium 2.5 mm long. Lateral nerves c. 45° or less to the midrib. — Philippines.
Midrib and nerves on lower leaf surface (grey-)brown. Fruits 3-4.7 cm long, minutely dull grey-brown, scurfy, sometimes partly glabrescent. — Philippines (excl. Palawan).

Midrib and nerves purplish or reddish brown, contrasting with grey-brown lower leaf surface. Fruits 3-7 cm long, with short dark rusty or orange-brown indumentum, sometimes partly glabrescent in var. duplex. — Philippines (Palawan, Mindoro).
Buds elongate, mostly markedly angular towards the apex; the apex (sub)acute.
Buds not angular, apex rounded. [Lower leaf surface generally papillose.].
Buds ovoid-oblong, (4.5-)5-7 by 3-4 mm, hairs 0.1 mm. Leaves below grey-brown with contrasting bright brown nerves, not or but indistinctly papillose. — Philippines.

Buds ± elongate, (elliptic-)oblong, 4.5-8 by 2-3 mm, with hairs (0. l-)0.2-0.5 mm. Leaves below dull, sometimes whitish (origin of pale colour unknown), nerves not much contrasting. — W Sarawak, W & NE Kalimantan, Sulawesi, Sulu Is., Philippines, N Moluccas (Sula, Bacan).
Buds 5-11 mm long. — Moluccas (or cultivated).
Buds 3-4.5(-5) mm long, rough-pubescent. Nerves on upper leaf surface flat or distinctly impressed.
Buds either glabrous, early glabrescent, or short-haired. Nerves 6—12(—15) per side, above flat or but little impressed, much raised below.
Buds conspicuously pubescent. Leaves large, 25-45 cm long, lateral nerves 25-30 per side, impressed above. Bark of twigs longitudinally cracking. — N Moluccas (Bacan).
Pedicel more than 1 mm thick. Flowers thinly pubescent. Leaves subcoriaceous, 9-22 cm long, below late glabrescent, at first with minute indumentum. Twigs 2-3.5 mm diam. — N Moluccas.

Pedicel less than 1 mm thick. Flowers glabrescent, at first with sparse very minute indumentum. Leaves chartaceous, 6-13 cm long, early glabrescent. Twigs 1-2 mm diam. — Originating from Banda (Moluccas); known only from cultivated specimens.
Leaves membranous, whitish below, not obviously papillose. — Sulawesi.
Leaves chartaceous, pale brownish below, distinctly papillose. — Moluccas, Papua Barat (Bird's Head).
Buds elongate, (10-)13-15 by 2.5-5 mm.
Buds ± ovate, less than 10 mm long.
Twigs ridged or winged, myrmecophilous. — Kai Is. (& New Guinea).
Twigs not winged, not myrmecophilous. — Moluccas (Halmahera, Obi).

Most parts with conspicuously long hairs, 1-3 mm (lower leaf surface glabrescent). Bark of twigs blackish, longitudinally cracked or flaking. [Fruits 4-6(-7) cm long with hispid hairs 2-3(-4) mm.] — Borneo.
Hairs shorter, very short or up to 1 mm long, or indumentum (almost) absent
Twigs 4-7(-10) mm diam. (in Peninsular Malaysia 3 mm diam.).
Twigs generally 1—4(—5) mm diam. (sometimes 4-5 mm diam. in M. beccarii, M. fatua, M. nivea). — Plants not from Sumatra or Peninsular Malaysia.
Leaves rather narrow, 11-24(-30) by 3-6 cm, coriaceous. — Philippines (NE Luzon).
Leaves generally larger, comparatively broader, (15-) 17-40 cm long; membranous or chartaceous.
Lower leaf surface early glabrescent or with scattered minute scale-like hairs less than 0.1 mm (lens!).
Lower leaf surface densely tomentose (hairs may be very minute), not or not evidently papillose.
Lower leaf surface papillose (lens!). Buds 4.5-6 mm long. Fruits 3.5-5.5 cm long, with scurfy hairs 0.1 mm. — West Malesia (Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Borneo).
Lower leaf surface not or not evidently papillose.
Buds 8-8.5 mm long. Fruits not known. Twigs 5-10 mm diam.; leaves 30-40 by 14-20 cm, nerves distinct. — N Moluccas (Bacan).
Male flowers not known. Fruits globose, 5 cm diam. Twigs 4-5 mm diam.; leaves 20-30 by 6-10 cm, coriaceous, nerves indistinct. — C Sulawesi.
Lower leaf surface with pale scale-like hairs 0.1 mm only, thus seemingly glabrous. [Fruits 6 cm long, with rusty hairs 0.5-1 mm.] — Philippines.
Hairs on lower leaf surface conspicuous, brownish, 0.2-0.3(-0.4) mm. — Borneo, E Malesia.
Flowers pedicellate. Two species, distinguishable in the indumentum of the fruits.
Flowers sessile. Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long, with shaggy hairs 1-1.5 mm. — Lesser Sunda Islands.
Buds 6 mm long. Fruits 5.5-8.5 cm long, pericarp 10-15 mm thick, with scurfy hairs 0.1-0.2 mm. — N Moluccas.
Buds 4-6 mm long. Fruits 4-7 cm long, pericarp 3-12 mm thick, hairs 0.5-1 mm. — Philippines (Mindanao), Moluccas, Sulawesi, and a deviating specimen with male flowers from limestone in SE Kalimantan.
Lower leaf surface glabrous or early glabrescent, or with minute scattered hairs.
Lower leaf surface densely hairy; sometimes hairs small and scale-like, but densely set or interwoven (lens!).
Petiole proportionally long: leaves 10-15 cm long, petiole 20-35 mm long. [Male inflorescences and flowers not known.] — Philippines.
Petiole proportionally shorter.

Leaves small, elliptic-oblong, thinly coriaceous, (2.5-)4-7.5 cm long; lateral nerves faint. [Flowers not known. Fruits ovoid-ellipsoid, 2-2.5 cm long, pericarp 1-2 mm thick, with dense scurfy hairs 0.1 mm or less.] — Central Sulawesi.
Leaves larger.
Buds ± cylindrical, narrow; androphore about as long as the synandrium. — Moluccas, W New Guinea.

Buds proportionally broader, ± ovoid, ellipsoid(-oblong); androphore about as long as or shorter than the synandrium. [Androphore mostly pubescent, at least at base. Lateral nerves not particularly closely set.] — Mainly E Malesia.
Androphore glabrous. Lateral nerves comparatively closely set.
Androphore densely pubescent. [Buds 3.5-4 mm long.] Leaves pale below, lateral nerves not particularly closely set. — Moluccas.
Leaves membranous; venation distinct below. Buds 2.5-3 mm long. Fruits 2.2-3.6 cm long, minutely scurfy. — NE Moluccas, Papua Barat (Bird's Head).
Leaves chartaceous; venation faint below. Buds 4-6 mm long. Fruits 1.5—2.5(—3) cm long, minutely scurfy. — Moluccas, W New Guinea.
Lower leaf surface whitish grey or glaucous, glabrescent, at first with thin indumentum of which the stouter hairs leave minute scattered dark-coloured dots (lens!).
Leaf surfaces more concolorous; if whitish below, then not punctate.
Twigs 2-4 mm diam. Leaves 20-40 cm long. Buds 5-6 mm long. — Philippines (Mindanao), N Moluccas (Talaud Is.).
Twigs 1.5-3 mm diam. (in M. impressa up to 5 mm diam.). Leaves up to 25 cm long. Buds 4(-5) mm long (only known in M. impressa, M. pilosogemma).
Leaf bud with hairs 1 mm. — Philippines.
Hairs shorter. Three species from Sulawesi: for distinction see the regional key. 62. M. impressa, 74. M. kjellbergii,
Buds more than 3 mm long.
Buds 2.5 mm long. — N Moluccas.lib.
Buds ± angular towards apex. — Philippines [incl. one fruiting collection from C Sulawesi, Kjellberg 2990, discussed under M. impressa.].
Buds not angular.
Twigs 2-2.5 mm diam. or more.
Twigs l-2(-2.5) mm diam. — Moluccas, W New Guinea.
Male flowers not known but, judged from the sessile female flowers, subsessile or with short pedicel. — Lesser Sunda Islands.
Pedicel about as long as the perianth.
Bark of twigs soon cracking and/or flaking. Fruits 6 cm long, glabrescent; male flowers not known. — Philippines (Basilan).
Bark not or faintly cracking and flaking. Fruits smaller, with indumentum of minute hairs.
Leaves coriaceous. — S Taiwan, Philippines (N Luzon); mainly a coastal species.
Leaves ± chartaceous.

Inflorescences much resembling a subsessile wart-like scar-covered brachyblast, but possibly essentially paniculate. Fruits 4.5-6.5 cm long, powdery pubescent with hairs 0.1 mm, or partly glabrescent. — Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
Fruits 2.5-4.5 cm long, with hairs 0.1-0.2 mm, sometimes partly glabrescent. — Philippines (Mindanao), Moluccas.

Buds with hairs 0.1 mm. Pedicel about as long as the perianth. [Upper and lower leaf surface ± concolorous; lower leaf surface not papillose, venation indistinct. Bracteole persistent. Fruits subglobose, 2.5-3 cm long, pericarp 4-8 mm thick, hairs 0.1 mm.] — Moluccas, W New Guinea.
Hairs longer, 0.2-0.5 mm. Pedicel usually shorter than the perianth.
Buds cleft c. 1/3 to nearly 1/2. Inflorescences pedunculate. — N Moluccas, Papua Barat (Bird's Head).
Buds cleft c. 1/4. Inflorescences all sessile. — SE Moluccas (Tanimbar), S New Guinea, N Australia.

Leaf bud and apex of young twigs with minute greyish hairs, glabrescent; lower leaf surface with minute grey-silvery scale-like hairs less than 0.1 mm. [Fruits 4.5-6.5 cm long, ± glabrescent or with scurfy minute hairs 0.1 mm.] —Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
Indumentum more conspicuous, cinnamon or pale rufous, hairs (0.1-)0.2 mm or more.
Twigs (2.5-)4-5 mm diam., bark lower down with lenticels. Leaves 20 cm long or more, membranous or chartaceous. — E Malesia.
Twigs l-4(-5) mm diam., if 4(—5) mm, then without lenticels. Leaves 20(-25) cm long or less.
Male flowers pedicellate. Fruits 4-7 cm long, with hairs 0.5-1 mm. — Philippines (Mindanao), Sulawesi, Moluccas (M.fatua), Am Is. (M. inutilis).
Judged from female, flowers subsessile. Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long, with shaggy hairs 1-1.5 mm. — Lesser Sunda Islands.
Twigs 1-2 mm diam. [Leaves membranous to thinly coriaceous. Buds 2-2.5 mm long.] — W New Guinea, Aru Is.
Twigs 2-4(-5) mm diam.
Twigs 2-3 mm diam. Leaves thinly coriaceous, base rounded or short-acute, nerves above not distinct. Flowers insufficiently known. Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long, with scurfy hairs 0.2-0.5 mm. — Borneo.

Twigs 3-4(-5) mm diam. Leaves coriaceous, at base rounded or emarginate, or sometimes short-acute; nerves above sunken, but distinct. Flowers with a conspicuous collar of hairs at base of androecium, sterile apex minutely pubescent. Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long, hairs woolly, 0.5-1 mm. — Sumatra, Borneo.

footnote.footnoteString: *) Male inflorescences and flowers of several species are not known, and the place in the key of these species may be erroneous.
**) The use of fruit characters in a key mainly for male flowering specimens may be helpful when obviously identical material of both sexes is available.

key.keyTitle: (2) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — PENINSULAR MALAYSIA, SINGAPORE, SUMATRA, JAVA (14 species)
key.keynotes: (based on male flowering, female flowering and fruiting specimens, with emphasis on vegetative characters)

question.text: Inflorescences sessile, a densely scar-covered wart-like brachyblast; peduncle absent or up to 2 mm long.
Inflorescences pedunculate, branched.
Leaf bud with hairs more than 0.2 mm. Mature leaves short-pubescent below. [Male flowers: androecium ± sessile, with a collar of conspicuous hairs around the base, sterile apex ± pubescent.].
Leaf bud with hairs 0.2 mm or less. Lower leaf surface finely papillose, early glabrescent.
Leaves membranous to thinly chartaceous. Female buds (4-)5-6(-9) mm long; lobes 0.4 mm thick. Fruits 3-4.5 cm long. Male pedicel 4-6 mm long. A species close to M. crassa. — C & E Java.
Leaves chartaceous to thinly coriaceous. Female buds 4-5 mm long; lobes 0.2-0.3 mm thick. Fruits (3.5-)4-5.5 cm long. Male pedicel (5-)6-12 mm long. Plant generally stouter than M. teijsmannii.
Leaf bud with short hairs 0.1-0.2(-0.3) mm or less.
Leaf bud with hairs more than 0.2 mm long.
Lower leaf surface with (sub)persistent dense indumentum (hairs, even if small, touching or interwoven; old leaves may be glabrescent). Fruits with scurfy hairs 0.1 mm long.
Lower leaf surface glabrous (early glabrescent) or with ± sparse, neither touching nor interwoven, minute hairs. Indumentum of fruits variable, or fruits glabrous
Buds (preferably to be seen in male flowers) ± angular in the upper part. Twigs 1.5-2.5(-4) mm diam. Leaves (8—) 10—22 cm long, lateral nerves 10—17 per side. [Fruits 5-9 cm long, often subsessile.].
Buds not angular. Twigs 2-8 mm diam., leaves 15-40 cm long, with 16-33 lateral nerves per side.
Twigs (4-)5-8 mm diam. Leaves 16-40 cm long, drying dark brown, lateral nerves (20-)23-33 per side. Fruits 6-9 cm long.
Twigs 2-3 mm diam. Leaves 15-30 cm long, drying olivaceous, nerves 16-23 per side. Fruits 5-7 cm long.

Fruits glabrous, or largely or almost completely glabrescent, or fruits inconspicuously pubescent with remote or scattered (not densely set) minute hairs, in glabrescent fruits rarely some minute indumentum remaining in sheltered places near the insertion of the pedicel. Lateral nerves c. 20 per side, or fewer.

Fruits with persistent dense-scurfy indumentum, or fruits but partly glabrescent and then always with distinct patches of (dense) indumentum in sheltered places of the dried fruits, especially towards the insertion of the pedicel (hairs may be very small). Lateral nerves (20-)23-30 per side; lines of interarching distinct. [Inflorescences widely paniculate. Twigs stout. Fruits (4.5-)6-9 cm long. Male buds 5-7 mm long.].

Twigs and leaves drying yellowish; lateral nerves 8—13(—15) per side. [Fruits drying dark brown or blackish, often with a green-yellowish exudate, 4.5-7.5 cm long, glabrescent, at first with minute scattered hairs 0.1 mm. Buds angular in the apical part.].
Twigs drying brown, leaves olivaceous or brown; lateral nerves 10 per side or more.

Lines of interarching of the lateral nerves on lower surface of mature (older) leaves raised and distinct. Male buds 3-3.5 mm long. Female buds 2-2.5 mm long, ovary glabrous. [Twigs 2-4 mm diam. Lateral nerves 14-20 per side. Papillae on lower leaf surface not apparent. Fruits 4-6 cm long, glabrous.].
Lines of interarching indistinct. Male and female flowers larger (female flowers not known of M. gigantea).

Leaves (15-)20-35 cm long, drying a dull greyish brown; lateral nerves below ± flat or but slightly raised; not papillose. Fruits 5.5-9 cm long, drying (dark) brown, glabrescent, at first with hairs 0.1 mm, pericarp (5-) 10-15(-20) mm thick.
Leaves smaller, 7-24 cm long, drying olivaceous-brown; lateral nerves raised below; papillose or not. Fruits 3.5-8 cm long, drying bright brown, glabrescent, hairs woolly-scurfy, 0.1-0.3 mm.
Leaf apex acute-acuminate; lower surface not papillose. Fruits 3.5-6(-8) cm long, pericarp 4-10 mm thick.
Apex of leaves of fertile twigs acute or blunt; apex of leaves of sterile sapling twigs (acute-)acuminate; lower surface distinctly papillose. Fruits 5-8 cm long, pericarp 15-20 mm thick.

Leaves (12-) 15-35 cm long, with persistent indumentum below; lateral nerves 15-19(-25) per side. Leaf bud with hairs to 1(—1.5) mm. Fruits 2.5-4.5 cm long, hairs dense, shaggy, 0.5-1 mm. — Mainly a coastal species, but sometimes inland in degraded forest.

Leaves 7-35 cm long, glabrous (glabrescent) below; papillose; lateral nerves 10-18 per side. Leaf bud with appressed hairs 0.5-1 mm. Fruits 5 cm long or more, glabrescent or with persistent indumentum.

Twigs 1.5-2.5(-3) mm diam. Leaves (of fertile twigs) small, 7—12(—15) cm long, apex acute, blunt, or rounded; lateral nerves 10—15(—18) per side. Fruits 5-8 cm long, (late) glabrescent, hairs scurfy, 0.2 mm. Flowers with hairs 0.2-0.5 mm.
Twigs (2-)2.5-6 mm diam. Leaves 12-35 cm long, the apex acute-acuminate; lateral nerves 13-22 per side. Hairs of fruits larger, 0.5 mm or more. Hairs of flowers 0.5-1 mm.
Twigs (2-)2.5-4 mm diam. Leaves chartaceous or thinly coriaceous. Fruits 7-9 cm long, glabrescent, hairs scurfy, 0.5 mm. Male buds 6-7 mm long
Twigs 3-6 mm diam. Leaves coriaceous. Fruits (5-)6-7 cm long, with conspicuous persistent shaggy hairs 1-2 mm. Male buds 4-4.5 long.

key.keyTitle: (3) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — BORNEO (20 species)
key.keynotes: (applicable for all fertile specimens; characters primarily vegetative)

question.text: Leaf bud with minute, appressed hairs, 0.1-0.2(-0.3) mm or less.
Hairs more than 0.2 mm.

Lower leaf surface with (sub)persistent dense indumentum (hairs may be very small), old leaves sometimes glabrescent. Fruits with woolly scurfy hairs 0.1 mm. [Inflorescences with distinct peduncle (often short in female).].
Lower leaf surface glabrous or early glabrescent or with scattered (not dense) minute hairs. Fruits with variable indumentum, glabrous, or glabrescent.

Buds (best to be seen in male flowers) ± angular in the upper part. Twigs 1.5-2.5 (-4) mm diam. Leaves (8-)10-22 cm long, lateral nerves 10-17 per side. [Fruits 5-9 cm long, often subsessile. Check also M. smythiesii.].
Buds not angular. Twigs 2-8 mm diam. Leaves 15-40 cm long, with 16-33 lateral nerves per side.
Twigs (4-)5-8 mm diam. Leaves 16-40 cm long, drying dark brown; lateral nerves (20-)23-33 per side. Fruits 6-9 cm long.
Twigs 2-3 mm diam. Leaves 15-30 cm long, drying olivaceous; nerves 16-23 per side. Fruits 5-7 cm long.

Inflorescences pedunculate; perianth largely glabrous (except in M. gigantea and M. papyracea). Fruits glabrous, glabrescent, or with minute scattered hairs; in glabrescent fruits sometimes a minute indumentum remaining in sheltered places near the insertion of the pedicel.

Inflorescences a sessile brachyblast, or pedunculate; perianth pubescent. Fruits with persistent dense-scurfy indumentum, or partly glabrescent but with dense indumentum remaining in sheltered places.

Buds (especially in male flowers) sharply angular in the apical part. Twigs and leaves drying yellowish; lateral nerves 8—13(—15) per side. [Fruits drying dark brown or blackish, often with a green-yellowish exudate, 4.5-7.5 cm long, glabrescent, hairs minute, scattered, 0.1 mm.].
Buds rounded. Twigs drying (yellowish) brown, leaves olivaceous or brown; lateral nerves 10-30 per side.
Lines of interarching of lateral nerves on lower leaf surface (of mature leaves) indistinct.
Lines of interarching raised and distinct.
Bracteole (in male flowers) subpersistent or late caducous. Leaf apex acute-acuminate; lower leaf surface not papillose. Fruits 3-6(-8) cm long, pericarp 3-10 mm thick.
Bracteole caducous. Apex of leaves of fertile twigs acute or blunt; lower leaf surface papillose. Fruits 5-8 cm long, pericarp 15-20 mm thick.

Leaves membranous, chartaceous, or subcoriaceous, 7-24 cm long. Peduncle in female to 1 cm long, 1-2 mm thick. Fruits 4-6(-8) cm long, pericarp 4-10 mm thick, late or early glabrescent. Male buds 4-6(-7) mm long.
Leaves thinly membranous, 7-14 cm long. Peduncle in female 1-2.5 cm long, 1.5 mm thick. Fruits 3-4 cm long, early glabrescent; pericarp 3-4 mm thick. Male buds 3 mm long.

Twigs 2-4 mm diam. Leaves about 3 times longer than broad, 10-30 by 4-9.5 cm, apex acute-acuminate, base rounded to acute; lateral nerves 14-20 per side; lower leaf surface papillose or not. Male buds 3-3.5 mm long. Female buds 2-2.5 mm long. Fruits 4-6 cm long.

Twigs 4-8 mm diam. Leaves large and comparatively broad, 16-44 by 8-14.5 (-18) cm, apex blunt or acute, not acute-acuminate, base ± rounded or subcordate; nerves (16-)20-28 per side; lower leaf surface papillose. Male buds 6-8 mm long. Female buds 6 mm long. Fruits 7-9 cm long.
Inflorescences (and infructescences) with a peduncle, and ± branched.
Inflorescences sessile, a short, scar-covered sessile brachyblast. [Leaves chartaceous or thinly coriaceous.].
Leaves 16-40 cm long; lateral nerves 16-30 per side. Inflorescences large, widely paniculate, 6-18 cm long in male, (1.5—)5—9 cm in female. Fruits 6-8 cm long
Leaves 10-30 cm long; lateral nerves 13-20(-22) per side. Inflorescences 2-6 cm long in male, 1.5-2.5 cm long in female. Fruits (4.5-)5-7.5 cm long. [Male buds 3-4 mm long.].
Twigs (4-)5-8 mm diam. Leaves: lateral nerves (20-)23-30 per side; lines of interarching ± distinct; papillae usually apparent. Male buds 5-7 mm long.
Twigs 2.5-5 mm diam. Leaves: lateral nerves 16-24 per side; lines of interarching ± indistinct; papillae not apparent. Male buds 4(-4.5) mm long
Twigs 5-10 mm diam. [Bark usually conspicuously cracking and flaking.] Leaf bud [and fruits] with very conspicuous villous hairs (1—)2—3 mm. [Inflorescences sessile.].
Twigs 6 mm diam. or less. Leaf bud with hairs 1.5 mm or less.
Leaves pubescent below. Fruits 2.5-4.5 cm long.
Leaves glabrous below. Fruits 5 cm long or more.
Inflorescences (best to be seen in male specimens) branched and with distinct ± flattened main peduncle, with flowers in subumbels or spikes. Fruits 2.5-4.5 cm long.

Inflorescences (sub)sessile scar-covered short-shoots lasting several flowering seasons. Fruits densely pubescent, 2.5-3.5 cm long. [Leaf bud with hairs up to 0.5(-l) mm. — Inland species; not from limestone.].

Twigs 3-5(-10) mni diam. Leaves (12—) 15—35 cm long; lateral nerves 15—19(—25) per side. Leaf bud with hairs to 1(—1.5) mm. Buds rounded towards apex. Fruits 2.5-4.5 cm long, densely shaggy pubescent with hairs 0.5-1 mm. — Mainly a coastal species, but sometimes inland in degraded forest.

Twigs 1.5-3.5 mm diam. Leaves 11-20 cm long; lateral nerves 10-18 per side. Leaf bud with appressed hairs 0.5-1 mm. Buds sharply angular towards apex. Fruits 3.5-4 cm long, glabrescent or with thin scattered pale brown appressed hairs to 0.5 mm. — W Sarawak, NE Kalimantan; mostly from limestone.
Twigs 2-3 mm diam. Leaves thinly coriaceous, base rounded or short acute; nerves not distinct above. Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long, with scurfy hairs 0.2-0.3(-0.5) mm.
Twigs 3-4(-5) mm diam. Leaves coriaceous, base rounded or emarginate, sometimes short-acute; nerves distinct above. Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long, with woolly hairs 0.5-1 mm.
Male flowers: androecium ± sessile, with a collar of conspicuous hairs at base, sterile apex ± pubescent.
Androecium with distinct androphore, sterile apex without hairs. One collection, see note 3 under.
Lower leaf surface concolorous with upper surface, not papillose. Fruits glabrous (early glabrescent).
Lower leaf surface distinctly papillose, generally paler than upper leaf surface. Fruits either with persistent indumentum, late glabrescent, or early glabrescent in M. gi-gantea.

Leaves membranous, up to 24 cm long, base attenuate. Twigs up to 4 mm diam., smooth or striate, the bark of the twigs lower down cracking or not; leaf bud slender, 7-12 by 1-2 mm. Fruits to 8 cm long, pericarp 5-10 mm thick. — Stout forms, mainly from NE Borneo.

Leaves chartaceous, 15-35 cm long, base broadly rounded. Twigs (4-)5-6 mm diam., bark early conspicuously cracking; leaf bud stout, 10-15 by 4-6 mm. Fruits 7.5-9.5 cm long, pericarp 15-20 mm thick. — NE Borneo.
Twigs 1.5—2.5(—3) mm diam. Leaves 7—12(—15) cm long, chartaceous, apex acute, blunt, or rounded; lateral nerves 10—15(—18) per side. Fruits 5-8 cm long, (late) glabrescent, hairs scurfy, 0.2 mm.
Twigs 3-6 mm diam. Leaves 14-35 cm long, coriaceous, the apex acute-acuminate; lateral nerves 13-22 per side. Fruits (5-)6-7 cm long, with conspicuous persistent shaggy hairs 1-2 mm.

key.keyTitle: (4) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — LESSER SUNDA ISLANDS (3 species)

question.text: Inflorescences or infructescences short peduncled. — Bali
Inflorescences sessile.
Leaves with persistent dense indumentum below. Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long, hairs shaggy, (1-)1.5 mm. — Sumbawa, Flores.
Lower leaf surface glabrescent. Fruits 2.5-4 cm long, hairs 0.5 mm. — Not in Bali or Lombok.

key.keyTitle: (5) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — SULAWESI (8 species)
key.keynotes: (applicable for all fertile specimens)

question.text: Leaves (15-)20-40(-50) cm long; lower surface with persistent short dense indumentum. [Inflorescence a (sub)sessile, short brachyblast]
Leaves generally smaller; lower surface glabrous, glabrescent, or with minute sparseindumentum.
Inflorescences (infructescences) with a peduncle. Buds angular in apical part. Fruits glabrescent or with sparse greyish hairs.
Inflorescences sessile or pedunculate. Buds rounded in apical part, not angular (of some species male flowers not known). Fruits with (minute) rusty indumentum
Twigs 1-2 mm diam.
Twigs generally thicker, 1.5-5 mm diam. Inflorescence a (sub)sessile brachyblast, peduncle absent or to 2 mm long only.
Leaves membranous, 9-19 cm long. Inflorescences slenderly pedunculate, sometimes subsessile. Flowers small, conspicuously rough-hairy. Fruits not known.
Leaves coriaceous, (2.5-)4-7.5 cm long. Inflorescences sessile. Flowers not known. Fruits ± ellipsoid, 2-2.5 cm long. — Ultrabasic soils of Central Sulawesi.

Twigs 4-5 mm diam. Leaves coriaceous, lower leaf surface not whitish, not minutely dotted (lens!). [Fruits subglobose, 5 cm diam.; pericarp nearly woody, 10 mm thick.] — Central Sulawesi; soils on conglomeratic and ultrabasic bedrock; 400 m.
Twigs 1.5-5 mm diam. Leaves membranous, lower surface conspicuously pale, minutely dark-dotted (lens!).
Twigs 4-5 mm diam. Female flowers and fruits (sub)sessile. Fruits subglobose, 2-2.5(-3) cm long; pericarp 1-3 mm thick, hairs 0.1-0.2 mm. [Male flowers not known.] — N, C and SW Sulawesi.
Twigs 1.5-4(-5) mm diam. Female flowers and fruits stipitate. Fruits ± ellipsoid, 3-4 cm long; pericarp 3-6(-8) mm thick, hairs 0.1 mm.
Twigs 1.5-3 mm diam. Fruiting pedicel 6-10 mm long, conspicuously pubescent, hairs 1-1.5 mm. [Male flowers not known.] — NE Sulawesi (Minahasa).
Twigs 2-4(-5) mm diam. Fruiting pedicel 3-5(-7) mm long, glabrescent or with hairs to 0.5 mm only. — Sulawesi (except Minahasa); incl. Kjellberg 2990.

key.keyTitle: (6) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — PHILIPPINES (20 species)
key.keynotes: (applicable for all fertile specimens; characters primarily vegetative)

question.text: Lower leaf surface with a persistent dense indumentum; whenever the hairs are small they are densely interwoven.
Lower leaf surface either with ± spaced silky hairs, with a very minute cobweb-like covering (to be seen with a lens only), glabrous, or glabrescent.
Hairs of leaf bud (0.1-)0.5-l mm. [Inflorescences mostly pedunculate. Fruits 2.5-4 cm long, with conspicuous shaggy hairs 0.5-1 (-2) mm.]
Hairs of leaf bud shorter.
Twigs (3-)4-8 mm diam. Leaves (15-)20 cm long or more. Inflorescences a (sub)-sessile scar-covered wart-like brachyblast. Fruits with minute or longish hairs, to 1 mm.
Twigs 1-2.5(-4) mm diam. Leaves (5-)8-22 cm long. Inflorescences pedunculate. Fruits with short scurfy hairs, 0.1-0.2 mm.
Leaves coriaceous, oblong-lanceolate, (15-)20 cm long. [Petiole proportionally long, 20-35 mm.] — NE Luzon: Palanan area.
Leaves herbaceous or chartaceous, elliptic-oblong, 15-50 cm long.

Twigs 5-8 mm diam. Leaves tapered (narrowed) in the lower half, nerves 30-35 per side; lower leaf surface with whitish dense felty hairs 0.1 mm or less, thus seemingly glabrous (lens!). Fruits (5-)6-6.5 cm long.
Twigs 3-4(-6) mm diam. Lower leaf surface with yellowish brown hairs 0.1-0.2(-0.5) mm. Fruits 3.5-6.5(-7) cm long.
Lower leaf surface with minute persistent hairs. Midrib below brown or yellowish. Fruits 5-9 cm long. — Probably Mindanao.
Lower leaf surface late glabrescent. Midrib below purplish, contrasting with greyish surface. Fruits 3-7 cm long. — Palawan, Mindoro.
Buds in apical part sharp-angular. Inflorescences mostly pedunculate and branched. Fruits rather small, 1.5-3 cm, with scattered hairs or glabrescent.
question.toTaxon: M. simiarum [subsp. simiarum and subsp. celebica]

question.text: Apical part of buds not or not sharply angular. Inflorescences sessile or pedunculate (and branched). Fruits variable.

Leaves chartaceous or coriaceous, 10-24(-30) cm long; petiole proportionally long, 20-35 mm. Inflorescences (infructescences) sessile. Fruits large, (5-)6-7 cm long [with minute dark rusty scurfy indumentum].
Leaves coriaceous, chartaceous, or membranous; petiole proportionally shorter. Inflorescences sessile or pedunculate. Fruits large, or smaller.
Leaves coriaceous, ll-24(-30) by 3-6 cm; lateral nerves (15-)20 per side. Twigs 4-6 mm diam. — NE Luzon: Palanan area.
Leaves chartaceous, 10-15 by 2.5-6 cm; nerves c. 10 per side. Twigs 2-3 mm diam. Petiole proportionally long — Luzon, Biliran.
Twigs 3-5(-10) mm diam. Leaves large, to 45 cm long. Inflorescences or infructescences with a peduncle. Fruits large, (4-)5-8 cm long, with persistent indumentum.
Twigs 1-5 mm diam. Leaves generally smaller, to 20(-30) cm long, and inflorescences pedunculate or (sub)sessile brachyblasts. Whenever fruits are large, they are glabrescent.
Leaf bud with hairs l(-2) mm. Fruits with hairs 0.3-0.5 mm.
Leaf bud with hairs 0.1-0.2(-0.3) mm. Fruits with scurfy hairs 0.1 mm. [Female flowers not known.].
Twigs 1-2 mm diam. Fruits 3.5-4 cm long, indumentum minute, soon glabrescent. Lower leaf surface distinctly papillose. Bracteole in female flowers well below the perianth. — Palawan.
Twigs 2-5 mm diam. Fruits pubescent or glabrescent. Lower leaf surface papillose or not. Bracteole at apex of pedicel.
Leaves lanceolate, lateral nerves 20-30 per side, flat or slightly raised below (not to be felt with the finger); very distinctly papillose (lens!). Pericarp 10 mm thick.
Leaves elliptic or lanceolate, lateral nerves c. 20 per side or fewer, generally raised below; papillae absent or present, conspicuous or not (lens!). Pericarp usually less than 10 mm thick.
Nerves c. 45° or less to the midrib. Inflorescences (best to be seen in male specimens) pedunculate, the flowers in subumbels.
Nerves c. 45° or more to the midrib. Inflorescences with few flowers at the end of a sessile scar-covered, wart-like brachyblast lasting several flowering seasons
Nerves (45-)60° to the midrib. Lower leaf surface not papillose. — Mindanao: Surigao (Wenzel 3537).
Nerves less than 60° to the midrib. Lower leaf surface ± papillose.
Fruits 3-4.7 cm long, with dull grey-brown scurfy indumentum. Midrib on lower leaf surface (yellow-)brown when dry, not much contrasting
Fruits 3-7 cm long, with bright dark rusty or orange-brown scurfy indumentum. Midrib on lower leaf surface drying dark purplish or reddish, much contrasting.
Leaves below whitish, contrasting with upper surface; lower leaf surface minutely dotted by the scars of fallen larger hairs.
The two leaf surfaces ± concolorous or not, not dotted.
Twigs 1.5-2.5 mm diam. Leaves 20 cm long or less. Fruits ellipsoid, 3.5 cm long, with conspicuous fine-woolly hairs 0.5(-l) mm. Hairs of leaf bud 1 mm. — Mindanao, Samar.
Twigs 2-4 mm diam. Leaves 20-40 cm long, greyish below. Fruits ellipsoid, 3.5-4 cm long, hairs 0.1 mm or less. Hairs of leaf bud 0.1 mm. — Mindanao.
Bark of twigs soon cracking and/or flaking. Fruits 6 cm long, glabrous (glabrescent). [Male flowers not known.] — Basilan.
Bark not or only slightly cracking and flaking. Fruits shorter with minute indumentum.
Twigs 3-4 mm diam., lower down densely set with lenticels. Leaves coriaceous. [Fruits subglobose, 3-4 cm long, hairs 0.1-0.2 mm.] — Mainly a coastal species; 5 Taiwan, Philippines (N Luzon).
Twigs (1-)1.5-3 mm diam.; lenticels present or not. Leaves membranous or chartaceous.
Lenticels of twigs few and inconspicuous. Fruits subglobose or ellipsoid, 3.5-5 cm long, hairs 0.1 mm. Leaves 8.5-23(-28) cm long.
Lenticels present, distinct or not. Fruits ellipsoid, (2.5-)3-3.5(-4.5) cm long, hairs 0.1-0.2 mm. Leaves 14-35 cm long. — Mindanao.

key.keyTitle: (7a) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — MOLUCCAS (20 species)
key.keynotes: (based on male flowering specimens)

question.text: Male inflorescences branched, with a smooth main peduncle sometimes subsessile, slender, simple or branched; inflorescences lasting one or a few flowering seasons only.

Inflorescences (sub)sessile densely scar-covered simple or 2-4-furcate thickish woody short-shoots, lasting several flowering seasons, each season producing a number of new flowers at the apex; peduncle (non scar-covered part) absent or up to 2 mm long.
Plant wholly conspicuously glabrous. [Male flowers not known.] — Seram.
Indumentum obvious on terminal leaf bud.
Buds narrow, 6-8 by 2-3 mm, the apical part markedly angular, apex (sub)acute. — N Moluccas (Sula Is., Bacan, Bum). 123b. M. simiarum subsp. celebica b. Buds variable, not angular, apex rounded.
Buds 3-4.5(-5) mm long, [rough-pubescent. Nerves on upper leaf surface flat or impressed, lower leaf surface papillose.] — N Moluccas.
Buds 5-11 mm long.
Buds conspicuously pubescent. Leaves large, 25-45 cm long, lateral nerves 25-30 per side, impressed above. Bark of older twigs longitudinally cracked. — N Moluccas (Bacan).
Buds either glabrous, glabrescent, or short-haired. Leaves smaller, 6-22 cm long, lateral nerves fewer, above flat or but little impressed.
Pedicel 1 mm thick. Flowers thinly pubescent. Leaves subcoriaceous, 9-22 cm long, lower surface with minute indumentum, late glabrescent. Twigs 2-3.5 mm diam. — N Moluccas.

Pedicel less than 1 mm thick. Flowers glabrescent with sparse, very minute indumentum. Leaves chartaceous, 6-13 cm long, early glabrescent. Twigs 1-2 mm diam. — Origin Banda; known only from cultivated specimens.
Buds (10-)13-15 mm long.
Buds less than 10 mm long.
Twigs ridged or winged; inhabited by ants. — SE Moluccas (Kai Is.) and New Guinea.
Twigs not winged. — N Moluccas (Obi, Halmahera).
Twigs 4-7(-10) mm diam. Leaves (15-) 17-40 cm long.
Twigs 1-4(-5) mm diam. (4-5 mm in some material of M. fatua and M. inutilis). Leaves generally much shorter than 40 cm (15-40 cm in M. nived).
Lower leaf surface early glabrescent or with scattered, minute, scale-like hairs less than 0.1 mm (lens!). [Male buds 8-8.5 mm long.] — N Moluccas (Bacan).
Lower leaf surface densely tomentose (hairs may be minute). [Two species, distinguishable mainly by fruit characters.].
Buds 6 mm long. — N Moluccas.
Buds 4-6 mm long. — Moluccas (and Sulawesi, Philippines).
Lower leaf surface densely and persistently pubescent, the hairs may be short and scale-like (lens!).
Lower leaf surface glabrous, early glabrescent, or with minute scattered hairs
Twigs (2.5-)4-5 mm diam. Leaves 20 cm long or more. Buds 4-6 mm long.
Twigs 1-2 mm diam. Leaves 15 cm long or less. Buds 2-2.5 mm long. — Am Is.
Bracteole caducous; buds 4.5-6 mm long.
Bracteole persistent; buds 3-4.5 mm long. — Am Is.
Lower leaf surface with scattered dark brown dots and dashes (lens!). — Am Is.
Leaves without larger dots; small dots present or absent.
Leaves pale below, with minute dots representing hair scars. — Known in the Moluccas only from one sterile collection from Talaud Is.
Lower leaf surface not conspicuously pale, without dark dots (lens!).
Buds cylindrical, narrow; androphore about as long as the synandrium.
Buds ovoid or ellipsoid(-oblong); androphore about as long as or shorter than the synandrium, mostly pubescent, at least at base. [Lateral nerves not particularlydense.].
Androphore glabrous.
Androphore densely pubescent. [Buds small, 3.5-4 mm long. Leaves pale below.] — N Moluccas (Bacan, Obi, Bum).
Leaves membranous; venation distinct below. Buds 2.5-3 mm long. — NE Moluccas.
Leaves chartaceous; venation faint below. Buds 4-6 mm long.
Buds 2.5 mm long. — N Moluccas (Sula Is., Halmahera, Obi).
Buds more than 3 mm long.
Twigs 2-2.5 mm diam. or more.
Twigs l-2(-2.5) mm diam.
Perianth with hairs 0.1 mm. Pedicel about as long as the perianth. — N Moluccas.
Perianth with hairs 0.2-0.5 mm. Pedicel usually shorter than the perianth.
Buds cleft about 1/3 to nearly halfway. Inflorescences sessile or pedunculate. — N Moluccas.
Buds cleft c. 1/4. Inflorescences sessile. — SE Moluccas (Tanimbar).

key.keyTitle: (7b) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — MOLUCCAS (20 species)
key.keynotes: (based on female flowering and fruiting specimens)

question.text: Lower leaf surface with persistent dense indumentum; whenever the hairs are short they may be densely interwoven and thus the leaf may seem glabrous.
Lower leaf surface either glabrous, glabrescent, with sparse minute scattered hairs, or with a very minute cobweb-like covering (only visible with a lens).
Twigs l-2.5(-4) mm diam. Leaves 4.5-15 by 1.5-6 cm. Fruits 2.5-3 cm long, with scurfy hairs 0.1-0.2 mm. — Am Is.
Twigs 3-6 mm diam. Leaves 20 cm long or more. Fruits either with distinct hairs, 0.5 -1 mm, or hairs scurfy.
Fruits 4-6.5(-7) cm long, with conspicuous rusty hairs 0.5-1 mm. [Two taxa, with a different distribution, and distinguishable mainly by characters of the male flowers.].
Fruits 5-8.5 cm long, hairs dull cinnamon, scurfy, 0.1-0.2 mm. — N Moluccas.
Male buds 4.5-6 mm long; bracteole mostly caducous.
Male buds 3-4.5 mm long; bracteole persistent. — Am Is.
Twigs distinctly ridged or winged; myrmecophilous. [Fruits subsessile, more or less ovoid, 2 cm long, apiculate, minutely tomentulose.] —Kai Is.
Twigs neither ridged nor winged; not myrmecophilous.
Plants conspicuously glabrous. Flowers not known. — Seram.
Indumentum present on terminal leaf bud, twig, and flowers.
Leaves 6-17(-25) cm long, lower surface with scattered dots and dashes. — Am Is.
Leaves of various sizes, without dots and dashes.
Female buds much narrowed towards the acute apex, the apical part sharp-angular in cross section. Leaves to 30 cm long.
Apex of female buds narrowed or not, in cross section circular or at most bluntly angular, but not sharply angular. Leaves small or large, to 40 cm long.
Buds 5-6 mm long. Leaves below glabrous or with minute scattered hairs. Fruits 3-3.5 cm long, with scattered hairs 0.3-0.5 mm, or glabrescent. — N Moluccas (Sula Is., Bacan, Bum).
Buds 10 mm long. Leaves below with dense or scattered scale-like hairs 0.1-0.2 mm. Fruits 5-6 cm long, densely dark brown short-pubescent, hairs 0.2-0.3 mm. — N Moluccas.
Twigs 3-5(-10) mm diam. Leaves 25-45 cm long.
Twigs 1-5 mm diam. Leaves mostly less than 30 cm long (up to 43 cm long in M. nivea). [Fruits 2-5.5 cm long, pubescent, or fruits larger but then glabrous or early glabresent.].

Twigs 4-7(-10) mm diam.; bark of twigs conspicuously longitudinally cracking, ± flaking. Lower leaf surface papillose (lens!). [Fruits large, (4-)5-8 cm long, with persistent scurfy hairs 0.1-0.2 mm.] — N Moluccas (Bacan).
Twigs 5-10 mm diam.; bark of twigs striate, at most finely cracking and finely flaking. Lower leaf surface not papillose. [Female flowers and fruits not known.]— N Moluccas (Bacan).
Fruits glabrous or largely early glabrescent, hairs 0.1 mm or less. Inflorescences delicate, few-flowered, without or with a slender peduncle. [Leaves elliptic, with few lateral nerves per side.].
Fruits with persistent indumentum, hairs may be very short and inconspicuous. Inflorescences with or without a peduncle, with the flowers in a woody scar-covered short-shoot.
Twigs 2-3.5 mm diam. Leaves ± coriaceous, 9-22 cm long, below late glabrescent. Fruits 4.5-8 cm long. — N Moluccas.
Twigs 1-2 mm diam. Leaves chartaceous, 6-13 cm long, below early glabrescent. Fruits 4-6 cm long. — Cultivated (origin Banda).
Leaves pale below, with scattered dark-coloured small dots, representing hair scars (lens!). — Known in the Moluccas only from a sterile collection from Talaud Is.
Leaves not conspicuously pale below, without scattered dots.
Fruits 3-4 cm long, with conspicuous coarse hairs, (0.5-)l mm.
Fruits variable in size, hairs mealy, scurfy, or woolly, shorter, 0.1-0.5(-0.8) mm long.

Lower leaf surface greyish or whitish, glabrescent, indumentum weak, its stoutest hairs leaving numerous regularly spaced, small, dark dot-like scars (lens!). Fruits short-ellipsoid, 3-4.2 cm long, hairs 0.1-0.5 mm; pericarp thick and woody, 5 mm thick. — N & C Moluccas.
Upper and lower leaf surface more concolorous, or, whenever greyish or whitish, without small dots.
Leaves elliptic to oblong-lanceolate, 14-35 cm long. Fruits ellipsoid, (2.5-)3-3.5 (-4.5) cm long, hairs 0.1-0.2 mm.

Leaves generally smaller, elliptic to lanceolate, to 20 cm long. Fruits variable 18 18a. Lower leaf surface not papillose (lens!). Fruits subglobose, 2.5-3 cm long; pericarp 4-8 mm thick, hairs 0.1 mm or less. — N Moluccas.
Lower leaf surface papillose. Fruits ellipsoid; pericarp 1-5 mm thick, hairs short or long, 0.1-1 mm. [Four taxa, difficult to segregate without male flowers.].
Male inflorescences (short) pedunculate; male buds 2.5 mm long. [Fruits ovoid-ellipsoid, 3-4 cm long, with scurfy hairs 0.2 mm.] — N Moluccas (Sula Is., Halmahera, Obi).
Male inflorescences (sub)sessile; male buds 3-6 mm long.
Leaves membranous. [Venation on lower leaf surface distinct. Fruits 2-3.5 cm long, hairs 0.1(-0.2) mm.] Male buds small, 3 mm long — NE Moluccas.
Leaves chartaceous. Male buds 4-6 mm long.
Venation on lower leaf surface generally indistinct; lateral nerves 8-20 per side, rather dense; blade 4-17 cm long. Fruits 1.3—2.6(—3) cm long, hairs 0.1 mm.
Venation distinct or not; lateral nerves more lax, 6-12 per side; blade 7-24 cm long. Fruits 2.5-3.5(-3.8) cm long, hairs 0.3-1 mm. — SE Moluccas (Tanimbar Is).

key.keyTitle: (8) REGIONAL KEY TO THE SPECIES — NEW GUINEA (99 species)
key.keynotes: (based on male flowering, female flowering, and fruiting specimens)

question.text: Lower leaf surface with scattered brown or blackish dashes or dots (lens!). 2 b. Lower leaf surface not dotted (including all specimens with lower leaf surface covered with dense indumentum).
Male buds before anthesis with hooded bracteole, 8-9 mm long, enveloping the perianth, then caducous (compare also M. brassii). [Female flowers not known.] — Papua New Guinea; (250-)800-1000 m.
Bracteole, where known, much smaller, caducous or not, sometimes enveloping the perianth in very immature stages only.
Twigs (2-)3-5 mm diameter or more; most leaf blades 15 cm long or more.
Twigs 1—2(—3) mm diameter; most leaf blades 15(-20) cm long or less.

Leaves with dots on both upper and lower leaf surface; this sometimes apparent only towards the margin of the blade; lower leaf surface with subpersistent short and dense scale-like hairs 0.1 mm or less. Inflorescences (infructescences) short pedunculate*. — W New Guinea, but not known from Bird's Head; (sub)montane.
Leaves with dots on lower surface only; lower leaf surface glabrous or glabrescent, indumentum minute. Inflorescences sessile or pedunculate.
Inflorescences (best to be seen in male flowering specimens) without peduncle
Inflorescences with peduncle 5 mm long or more. Leaves membranous, chartaceous, or coriaceous.
Leaves chartaceous or subcoriaceous; nerves 20-30 per side, faint below. Male flowers: bracteole large, cucullate, caducous; androphore glabrous. — Papua New Guinea; (250-) 800-1000.

Leaves coriaceous; nerves c. 15 per side, distinct and contrasting in colour below. Male flowers: bracteole not seen; androphore conspicuously pubescent in the lower half. [Fruits not known.] — W New Guinea (SW of Bernhard Camp on Idenburg R.); c. 1700 m.

Twigs (2-)3 mm diam. Leaves 15-23 cm long, membranous; nerves c. 20 per side, on lower leaf surface contrasting in colour and clearly visible. [Infructescences short-pedunculate. Fruits 4.5-5 cm long. Flowers not known.] — Papua Barat (N Bird's Head, Tamrau Range); 500-800 m.
Twigs 5-7 mm diam. Leaves 20-40 cm long, chartaceous or coriaceous; nerves ± concolorous, 20-40 per side.

Leaves chartaceous or thinly coriaceous, drying dull with minutely wrinkled surface; lateral nerves thin but clearly visible below. Fruits 5.5-6 cm long. Flowers not known. — Central New Guinea; montane.
Leaves (thinly) coriaceous, drying smooth; lateral nerves faint below. Mature fruits not known. Male flowers: androphore completely pubescent.— Papua Barat (Bird's Head); lowland.
Specimen with female flowers and/or fruits.
Specimen with male flowers (not known in M. leptophylla).
At least some inflorescences or infructescences with a peduncle** 3 mm long or more.
Inflorescences or infructescences all sessile, or with a smooth peduncle up to 3 mm long.
Female buds 10 mm long. Fruits 4.5-6.5 cm long, style often persistent. — Most of New Guinea; lowland and submontane forest; up to 1000 m
Female buds (not seen in M. arfakensis) less than 10 mm long. Fruits 3-4.5 cm long, style not persistent. — Montane species, at 1000 m or more.
Dots on lower leaf surface clearly visible only with a lens. Fruits, including pseudo-stalk***, 3.5-4(-4.5) cm long. — Throughout New Guinea; montane.
Dots visible to the naked eye. Fruits (without pseudostalk) 3 cm long. — Papua Barat (Bird's Head); montane.
Fruits 1.5-2.5 cm long (not known in M.flavovirens). Nerves on lower leaf surface generally faint. — Lowland; up to 700 m (in Bird's Head to 1200 m).
Fruits 3.5-4.5 cm long. Nerves quite visible below. — Montane; 1400-2000 m
Leaves greenish. — Papua Barat (Bird's Head).
Leaves (dark) brown. [Twigs 2-3 mm diam. Fruits rounded at base.] — New Guinea, except Bird's Head.
Twigs l(-2) mm diam., brown. Leaves below grey(-brown). Fruits at base contracted into a 3 mm long pseudostalk.
Twigs 2-3 mm diam., blackish. Leaves below yellowish. Fruits not known. — Papua Barat (Bird's Head); montane.
Leaves (4-)6-14 cm long, (sub)coriaceous. Fruiting pedicel (l-)2 mm thick. — Throughout New Guinea; montane.
Leaves 10-20 cm long, membranous or (thinly) chartaceous. Fruiting pedicel 4(-5) mm thick. — Papua New Guinea (W Sepik Prov.); 1500 m
Inflorescences with a smooth, often more or less flattened peduncle (l-)3 mm long or more.

Inflorescences (sub)sessile, simple or forked, short, scar-covered, (± woody) brachyblasts producing flowers at the apex, lasting several seasons; peduncle absent or up to 3 mm long (including M. leptophylla of which male inflorescences and flowers are not known).
Twigs l(-2) mm diam. Male buds 3.5 by 1.5 mm. [Leaves greenish. Inflorescence sessile or l(-2) mm pedunculate. Bracteole small, persistent.] — Papua Barat (Bird's Head); lowland up to 900 m.
Twigs generally stouter, 2-3 mm diam. Male buds 3.5-5 mm long; if smaller, then not occurring in Bird's Head. — Throughout New Guinea.

Twigs dull or blackish brown. Leaves (dark) brown above, lower surface pale brown, not conspicuously papillose even seen under a strong lens. Inflorescences sessile. Flowers: pedicel 2-4 by 0.7 mm, bracteole caducous; buds 3.5-5 by 2-2.5 mm. — Throughout New Guinea; lowland up to 600 m.

Twigs blackish. Leaves greenish above, lower surface yellowish, densely papillose. Inflorescences with peduncle l(-2) mm long. Flowers: pedicel 4 by 1(—1.5) mm, bracteole minute, 1 mm long, persistent; buds 5 by 2.5 mm. — Papua Barat (Bird's Head); c. 1200 m.
Male buds 10 mm long or more. — Throughout New Guinea; lowland and lower montane areas.
Male buds 8(-10) mm long or less.
Dots on lower leaf surface mostly clearly visible only with a lens. Buds elongate, 6-7(-8?) mm long. — Most of New Guinea; montane.
Dots visible to the naked eye. Buds comparatively shorter and broader, 3.5-4 mm long. — Papua Barat (Bird's Head); montane.

Twigs medium-sized or stout, conspicuously hollow and ± angled by distinct raised lines or wings up to 2 mm high, at both sides of the twig connecting the bases of the petioles; perforated ant-swellings present (but sometimes not collected). Wings indistinct in M. ingrata subsp. velata.

Twigs slender, medium-sized, or stout, generally solid or narrowly hollow, (sub)-terete or ± angled, rarely with raised lines, without wings (stem sometimes ridged but not conspicuously hollow in M. hollrungii and M. sulcata)', ant-swellings absent.
Twigs and leaves exceedingly stout: twig 10 mm diam., leaves to 43 by 18 cm. Fruits 3.5 cm long with conspicuous hairs 1(—1.5) mm. — N Papua New Guinea (Sepik Prov.); lowland.
Twigs generally narrower, leaves smaller. Fruits with shorter indumentum.

Male buds cleft into lobes to over halfway; sizes of buds in one inflorescence variable; bracteole either small, 2-3 mm long (subsp. kostermansii), or large, (5-)7-8 mm long (subsp. fissiflora). [Lines of interarching of lateral nerves and venation distinct. Fruits not known with certainty.] — N New Guinea; lowland.
Male buds cleft 1/3 or less; bracteole 2-3 mm long.
Male buds ovoid or ellipsoid(-oblong), cleft 1/3-1/4; apex of synandrium blunt, sterile apex absent or to 0.2 mm long. Fruits rather small, up to 4 cm long.
Male buds oblong or tubiform, cleft 1/6-1/8, lobes 1-1.5 mm long; sterile apex of synandrium acute, 0.5-1 mm long. Fruits small or large, 1.5-7 cm long.

Bracteole caducous at anthesis. Fruits 1.5—2.5(—3) cm long, generally with persistent, short indumentum; fruiting pedicel 2-10 mm long. Venation generally faint. — Throughout New Guinea, incl. Aru and Kai Is., not in the Bismarck Archipelago; 0-2100 m.
Bracteole persistent at anthesis. Fruits 5-7 cm long, (late) glabrescent. Venation faint or distinct. — Papua New Guinea (Bismarck Archipelago); lowland.

Sizes of flower buds in one inflorescence generally variable; bracteole persistent. [Female pedicel 2-5(-6) mm long. Fruits ovoid-ellipsoid, 2.5 cm long, apex narrowly or broadly rounded (with minute apiculum); fruiting pedicel ± stout, 3-10 mm long.] Lines of interarching of lateral nerves on lower leaf surface and venation generally faint. [Fruiting specimens may be confused with M. subalulata.] — N & S New Guinea; lowland and montane.
Flower buds in one inflorescence all of about the same size; bracteole caducous. Lines of interarching of lateral nerves on lower leaf surface and venation generally distinct.
Male buds 15 mm long, carnose; pedicel 7-8 mm long, bracteole scar below apex. Female flowers and fruits not known. — N Papua Barat; lowland
Male buds 5 mm long; pedicel longer (10 mm) with bracteole apical. Female pedicel 10 mm long; fruiting pedicel 10-15 mm long. — Papua New Guinea (W Sepik Prov., Upper Sepik River); lowland.
Twigs lined to sharply angular. — Central New Guinea; montane; 1500-2000 m or more.
Twigs lined, ridged, or terete. Plants from lowland or montane areas, but in the latter case twigs (sub)terete, neither lined nor angular.
[Flowers not known.] Twigs ± stout, 4-5 mm diam. Fruits subglobose, 6 cm diam., pericarp 20 mm thick. — Papua New Guinea (Milne Bay Prov., Mt Dayman); c. 1500 m.
Twigs generally more slender. Fruits smaller, 2-5.5 cm long, ± ellipsoid.
Male buds 6 or 9 mm long (according to the subspecies); bracteole persistent. Fruits 2.5 cm long. Twigs 2-4 mm diam. — Mountains of Papua New Guinea.
Male buds 10-14 mm long; bracteole caducous. Fruits 2 cm long. Twigs 5 mm in diam. — Papua New Guinea (Western Highlands Prov., Mt Hagen and vicinity); c. 2000 m.
Male buds 7-9 mm long, at base verrucose inside; bracteole caducous. Fruits 3.5-5.5 cm long. Twigs slender or medium-sized, 1.5-3 mm diam. — Throughout New Guinea; montane.

Twigs 1-3 mm diam., most leaves of fertile twigs 15(—17) cm long or less (specimens of M. inutilis, M. sphaerosperma, and M. subcordata may have rather small leaves, but these species have only been entered in the alternative lead).
Twigs (2-)3-5 mm diam. or more, generally most leaves of a specimen 15 cm long or more.
Specimen with female flowers or fruits. [Female flowers and fruits not known of several species, incl. M. schlechteri.].
Specimen with male flowers. [Male flowers not known of several species.].
At least some of the inflorescences or infructescences with a non scar-covered peduncle**** of 2 mm long or more.
All inflorescences sessile: a short simple or forked scar-covered brachyblast, sessile or with a smooth peduncle up to 2 mm long.
Leaves ensiform, parallel-sided, 12-22 cm long. Understorey near-tree of 1.5 m height. — Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.); c. 80 m; once found.
Leaves elliptic or oblong(-lanceolate). Trees generally larger.
Hairs of leaf bud (0.2-)0.5 mm or more.
Hairs of leaf bud short, 0.1-0.2(-0.3) mm or less.
Lower leaf surface with persistent dense indumentum, sometimes late glabrescent. — E Papua New Guinea (Morobe); montane; 1000-1500 m.
Lower leaf surface early (sometimes late) glabrescent or glabrous (or sometimes with persistent indumentum in M. mediovibex).
Lower leaf surface papillose (lens!).
Lower leaf surface not obviously papillose.
Fruits 3-4 cm long, with coarse hairs 0.5-0.8 mm long. — Moluccas and Papua Barat (Bird's Head).
Fruits 4-4.5 cm long, hairs 0.1 mm. — Papua New Guinea.
Bracteole caducous, about halfway the pedicel. [Mature fruits (incl. pseudostalk) 4 cm long. Lower leaf surface late glabrescent or with persistent indumentum.] — Northern part of W New Guinea.
Bracteole at or towards the apex of the pedicel.
Female peduncle slender, 20 mm long, 0.5-1 mm thick; fruiting pedicel 7-9 mm long. Fruits (incl. pseudostalk) 5-5.5 cm long. — E Papua New Guinea.
Peduncle 10 mm long, 1 mm thick; fruiting pedicel 14 mm long. Fruits incl. pseudostalk 2-2.5 cm long. — NE Papua Barat.
Peduncle 3-4 mm long; fruiting pedicel 2-4 mm long. Fruits (without pseudostalk) 2.5 cm long. — Papua New Guinea (Morobe Prov.); c. 100 m
Lower leaf surface seemingly glabrous, but actually with dense, very short indumentum (lens!).
Leaves below glabrous or glabrescent, or with a lax indumentum, hairs ± scattered, scale-like, minute only. [Female buds generally less than 8 mm long.].

Lower leaf surface with silvery short cobweb-like indumentum; leaf base cuneate. Older twigs rugose with conspicuous wart-like lenticels. Female buds 8-10 by 5-5.5 mm. Fruits early glabrescent, 7 cm long, wrinkled. — W Papua Barat; lowland.
Indumentum of lower leaf surface largely grey-brown or rust-coloured, very short. Bark of twigs not coarsely warty-lenticellate. [Flowers not known.] Fruits shortly rusty pubescent, not wrinkled.
Fruits 7 cm long. Petiole 2-3 cm long; blade base broadly rounded or ± cordate — Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.); lowland.
Fruits 2.5-3.5 cm long. Petiole 1.5 cm long; blade base cuneate — N Papua Barat.
Lower leaf surface papillose (lens!). Peduncle conspicuously flattened. Fruits (not known in M. rosselensis) ellipsoid or oblong, 2-3.5 cm long, glabrescent except at the ends.
Leaves not papillose below. Peduncle ± flattened or terete. Fruits variable in shape, 2.7 cm long or more, with minute scurfy indumentum (hairs scale-like).
Leaves narrow, oblong-lanceolate, base (sub)acute; lateral nerves c. 20 per side; nerves and venation faint. — Louisiade Archipelago.

Leaves proportionally broader, elliptic-oblong, base rounded; lateral nerves 8-15 per side; lateral nerves and venation ± evident. — N Papua New Guinea (Bismarck Archipelago), E to Solomon Islands; mostly coastal.

Lower leaf surface grey-white, glabrous. Inflorescences (infructescences) conspicuously supra-axillary. [Flowers not known.] Fruits without pseudostalk, ellipsoid-oblong, 2.7 cm long. — Papua New Guinea (Madang Prov.); at low altitude.
Lower leaf surface somewhat whitish or not. Inflorescences axillary or only shortly supra-axillary. Fruits 4 cm long or more, including pseudostalk (mature fruits not known in M. olivacea).
Leaves drying conspicuously greenish. Inflorescences slender, the peduncle 3 cm long; pedicel 18-20 mm, longer than the perianth. [Bracteole persistent.] — Papua New Guinea (Central Prov.); lowland.
Leaves drying (olivaceous-)brown; peduncle of inflorescences (infructescences) much shorter; pedicel variable.
[Female flowers and fruits not known.] Leaves drying conspicuously blackish brown. Bracteole in male flowers persistent. — Papua Barat and Papua New Guinea (Ingembit area, on the S border); lowland.
Leaves drying olivaceous or (dark) brown. Bracteole caducous.
Lateral nerves on lower leaf surface slightly raised, brown, contrasting with rest of blade.
Lateral nerves on lower leaf surface flat or ± sunken, almost concolorous. [Inflorescences generally lacking a peduncle.] — Papua New Guinea; montane.

Fruits (incl. pseudostalk) 4.5-6 cm long. — Papua New Guinea (Central Prov.); local, hill rain forest at 500-700 m (a deviating fruiting specimen from montane forest at 1300 m in Central Papua Barat).
Fruits 4 cm long. — Papua New Guinea (Central and Madang Prov.); montane forest at (400-) 1200-1600 m.
Fruits narrow, 8 by 1.5-2 cm. — SW Papua Barat; lowland or montane.
Fruits broader or shorter.

Lower leaf surface early glabrescent or covered with very minute scattered pale cobweb-like hairs only less than 0.1 mm long and papillose (lens!), the papillae rather uniform and regularly set. — Note: some species with the lower leaf surface very densely papillose and the papillae closely contiguous, or with the papillae irregular in shape and size or indistinct, are included in both leads or in the alternative lead; specimens of M. insipida and M. lancifolia may be indistinctly papillose.
Lower leaf surface glabrous, glabrescent, or pubescent, not or but faintly papillose, or papillae not readily recognized as such.
Fruiting pedicel 15-20 mm. Nerves at c. 45° to the midrib. — Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.); lowland.
Fruiting pedicel 5 mm long or less. Nerves at 60° or more to the midrib.

Lateral nerves 8-20 per side, not much contrasting in colour and faint below; venation generally indistinct. [Fruits small, ellipsoid, 1.3-1.6 cm long, with hairs 0.1 mm.] — Moluccas and W & E New Guinea.
Nerves 6-14 per side, below contrasting in colour or not; venation not much contrasting, indistinct or not.
Fruits ellipsoid, 1.5-2.5 cm long, including the short pseudostalk, with hairs 0.1-0.3 mm. [Fruiting pedicel 2-4 mm.] — E Papua New Guinea.
Fruits subsessile, ellipsoid(-oblong), 2.5-3.5(-3.8) cm long, with hairs 0.3-1 mm. — S New Guinea (also in S Moluccas and N Australia).
Fruits subsessile, ± ellipsoid, 3 cm long, with hairs 0.1 (-0.2) mm. — Local endemic of S Papua New Guinea (Central Prov.); sea level.
[Flowers not known.] Lateral nerves c. 25 per side, faint. Fruits egg-shaped, 7 by 5 cm, early glabrescent (a few light brown scattered appressed hairs excepted). — Rossel I.; at 200 m.
Lateral nerves c. 20 per side or less. Fruits generally less than 7 cm long.
Flowers glabrous or almost so. Fruits minutely pubescent or glabrescent.

Flowers pubescent (hairs may be minute and dense, the perianth seemingly glabrous (lens!); sometimes parts of the perianth late glabrescent). Fruits pubescent, hairs minute or larger. [Flowers not seen in M. brevistipes, M. firmipes, or M. lasiocarpœ, fruits glabrescent in M. crassipes.].
Fruiting pedicel 2-7 mm; fruits glabrescent. — Lowland; 0-250 m.
Fruiting pedicel 10 mm long or more.
Fruiting pedicel (20-)25-30 mm by 0.5 mm; fruits minutely pubescent, with long pseudostalk. — E Papua New Guinea (Lae subprov.); 0-15 m.
Fruiting pedicel stouter, 10-18 by 2 mm; fruits glabrescent, with short pseudostalk. — Papua New Guinea; montane, 1000-1800 m.
Leaves below either glabrescent (sometimes late), or with extremely minute indumentum of scale-like, ± spaced, not densely interwoven hairs.
Leaves below with persistent or subpersistent indumentum, with hairs densely set, long or short; or late glabrescent; hairs may be extremely short and scale-like
Innovations and flowers conspicuously densely clothed in rusty hairs 0.5-1 mm. — E Papua New Guinea; lowland. 20. M. chrysophylla, 120. M. schlechteri b. Hairs much shorter.
Fruiting pedicel 2 mm long, 1-2 mm thick; fruits 2.5-3 cm long, ellipsoid-oblong. [Flowers not known.].
Fruiting pedicel more than 2 mm long, slender or thick; fruits variable, comparatively broader: globose, short-ellipsoid, or ± pear-shaped.
Leaves pale below, nerves thin and faint on both surfaces. Bark of older twigs ± corky. — Local endemic of S Central New Guinea; 150 m
Leaves brown-green, not pale below, nerves stronger; twigs not corky.
Indumentum of fruits conspicuously woolly. Lower leaf surface faintly papillose. — S New Guinea (also in Moluccas, N Australia).
Indumentum of fruits short-woolly. Leaves not papillose. — Local endemic of Papua New Guinea (Central Prov.) (Check also M. concinna and M. brachypoda.).
Twigs ± 2-lined or 2-angled (usually indistinctly so in M. crassipes).
Twigs not or only faintly angled, including M. atrocorticata, a species with somewhat angled twigs but distinguishable by the flaking bark of older twigs.

Lower leaf surface drying (pale) brownish, nerves comparatively faint, yellow or orange-brown, not much contrasting. Fruits 2.5-4 cm long; seed attached above the base of the pericarp and hence ± transversely positioned in the fruit; fruiting pedicel ± stout, 10-25 by 2-3 mm; perianth sometimes glabrescent. — N & NE New Guinea; lowland and montane.

Lower leaf surface drying pale, greyish or not, midrib and nerves brown, and these generally contrasting. Fruits variable; seeds basal. Perianth minutely thinly pubescent, the hairs sometimes extremely small, thus the perianth seemingly glabrous.
Twigs 1 mm diam. Fruits in lower half contracted into a long pseudostalk.
Twigs (1.5—)2—3 mm diam. Fruits without or with pseudostalk; fruiting pedicel short or long.
Fruiting pedicel 20 by 0.5 mm. — E Papua New Guinea.
Fruiting pedicel 3-4 by 2 mm. — Papua New Guinea (Central Prov., Sogeri area).
Lowland; up to 500 m altitude.
Montane; 500 m altitude or higher.
Fruiting pedicel 30-35 by 1 mm; fruits with 10 mm long pseudostalk. — E Papua New Guinea.
Fruiting pedicel 3-10 by (3-)4-5 mm, fruits without or with short pseudostalk. [Leaves usually more than 15 cm long.] — Throughout New Guinea.
Fruiting pedicel 4-10(-12) by 3-5(-6) mm. — Throughout New Guinea.
Fruiting pedicel 10-15 mm by 1.5-3 mm. — E Papua New Guinea.
Fruiting pedicel 25-30 by 1 mm. — Papua Barat; 500 m.
Small tree, 1.5-8 m tall. Fruits solitary, with slender peduncle; fruiting pedicel 8-10 by 0.5 mm, the fruits itself with distinct pseudostalk, 10 mm long. — E Papua New Guinea.
Tree small or large. Fruits of variable sizes, single or 2-4 together per infructescence; fruiting pedicel stronger and proportionally shorter; fruits without or with much shorter pseudostalk.
Leaves coriaceous or membranous. — Montane; (300?-) 1600-1800 m.
Leaves subcoriaceous or membranous. [Fruits either globose, ± ellipsoid, or ± pear-shaped; fruiting pedicel short or medium-sized.] — Plants generally from lowland areas; 0-1000(-1500) m.

Fruits ellipsoid or ± fusiform, 3 cm long, the pericarp 3 mm thick; fruiting pedicel 10 by 3.5 mm. — Papua Barat (near Wissel Lakes); c. 1800 m (species resembling M. laevifolia, but nerves contrasting below).
Fruits globose, 2.5-3 cm diam., the pericarp 7 mm thick; fruiting pedicel 5-8 mm long. — Papuan Islands: Goodenough, possibly Tagula; 1600 m (and 300 m?; see note 2 under the species).
[Male and female flowers not known.] Fruits ± pear-shaped, 6-7 cm long, pericarp thick, woody, 10 mm thick; fruiting pedicel short and thick, broader than long, 4-10 by 5-9 mm. — W Papua New Guinea.
Fruits globose or ± ellipsoid, smaller, pericarp thinner; fruiting pedicel proportionally more slender.

Leaves below usually pale, grey-glaucous, with brownish contrasting nerves and coarsely reticulate contrasting venation. [Fruits variable in size and shape, (short-) ellipsoid or subglobose, 1.5-3.2(-4) cm long, with persistent short hairs 0.1-0.5 (-0.8) mm.] — Widespread; 0-600(-1500) m.
Both leaf surfaces generally rather concolorous; venation more faint.
Twigs 2-2.5 mm diam., somewhat angular.

Twigs 1-2 mm diam., subterete. [Bark of older twigs striate, ± flaking or not. Petiole long and slender (but proportionally shorter than in M. atrocorticata and M. inundata), 10-20(-23) mm long. Leaves glabrous (early glabrescent) below. Fruits with hairs 0.1(-0.2) mm.].
Bark of older twigs blackish, longitudinally cracking, or flaking. Petiole 20 mm long. [Leaves below late glabrescent, at first with minute scale-like hairs.].
Twigs brown, bark not flaking (but sometimes transversely cracked). Petiole 10-13 mm long. — Northern part of New Guinea; lowland.
Leaves oblong-lanceolate. Bracteole much shorter than the perianth. [Fruits not known.] — W Papua Barat (Bird's Head) and Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.); lowland.
Leaves (elliptic-)oblong. Bracteole in male flowers about as long as the perianth. [Female flowers not known.] — Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.).
Fruits subglobose or ellipsoid, 2.5-3.5 cm long. — Moluccas and West & East New Guinea.
Fruits ± ellipsoid-oblong, 2-3 cm long. — Moluccas and Papua Barat (Bird's Head). [See also M. concinna, but fruits ellipsoid, 1.5-2.5 cm long, and leaves usually papillose below.].
Fruits ellipsoid, 4.5-5 cm long. — Southern Solomon Islands.
question.toTaxon: M. guadalcanalensis W. J. de Wilde

question.text: Twigs 1.5 mm diameter. Leaves 4-14 cm long. — Moluccas and West New Guinea.
Twigs 2 mm diameter or more. Leaves generally 10 cm long or more.
Leaves below with silky, very short, (sub)persistent indumentum; venation ± tra-beculate. — Papua New Guinea (Northern Prov.); montane.
Indumentum more scaly or felty, short or longer; venation reticulate, or hardly visible.
Fruits 2 cm long; fruiting pedicel 15-18 by 1.5-2 mm. — Papua New Guinea (Ma-dang Prov.); lowland.
Fruits larger; fruiting pedicel shorter and thicker.
Flowers, fruits, and lower leaf surface with short hairs, 0.3(-0.5) mm long or less.
Flowers, fruits, and usually lower leaf surface with longer, shaggy hairs.
Lower leaf surface with scale-like hairs 0.1 mm long only. — Papuan Islands.
Lower leaf surface with dense, stellate hairs of mixed sizes, more than 0.1 mm long. — Widespread (check also M. subcordata).
Lower leaf surface with dense minute scale-like hairs, less than 0.1 mm long. [Female flowers and fruits not known.] — Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.); lowland, periodically inundated forest.
Lower leaf surface densely short-felty, with hairs 0.2-0.3 mm. — Papua New Guinea (West Sepik Prov., Telefomin subprov.; possibly Morobe Prov., Kuper Range); c. 2000 m.
Fruits subsessile. — E Papua New Guinea; lowland.
Fruiting pedicel (5-) 10 mm long. [Flowers not known.] — Papua New Guinea (Morobe Prov., Kuper Range); 1600-2000 m.
Inflorescences with a smooth, often ± flattened peduncle (l-)2 mm long or more, lasting one or several seasons.

Inflorescences (sub)sessile simple or forked scar-covered woody brachyblasts producing flowers at the apex, mostly lasting several flowering seasons; in some species with a peduncle to 2 mm long, in M. insipida the peduncle occasionally up to 4 mm long; inflorescences sometimes delicate with only a few flowers.
Leaves narrow, ensiform, 12-22 cm long. An understorey near-tree of 1.5 m. — Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.); c. 80 m.
Leaves elliptic or oblong(-lanceolate). Trees or shrubs, generally larger.
Leaf bud (and generally also young twig apices, inflorescences, and flowers) with hairs of a flossy appearance, the majority (0.2-)0.5 mm long or more.
Hairs 0.1-0.2(-0.3) mm long or less.
Male buds oblong, 7 mm long or more. [Male flowers not known in M. mediovibex, M. pilosella, M. pygmaea.].
Male buds ellipsoid(-oblong), 5 mm long or less.
Lower leaf surface with persistent ± dense indumentum, sometimes late glabrescent. Peduncle of male inflorescence up to 3 mm long.
Leaves early glabrescent or glabrous below. Peduncle longer.
Plants from montane area; 1000-1600 m. — Papua New Guinea (Morobe Prov.).
Plants from lowland area; c. 100 m [Male flowers not known.] — Papua New Guinea (Morobe Prov.).
Bracteole in female flowers caducous, borne halfway the pedicel. [Male flowers not known.] — N Papua Barat; lowland.
Bracteole persistent, at the apex of the pedicel. — E Papua New Guinea; montane.
Lower leaf surface papillose (lens!). Male buds ± ellipsoid; anthers 6-8.
Lower leaf surface not papillose. Male buds ellipsoid-oblong; anthers 3. — NE Papua Barat; lowland.
Leaves ovate-oblong or oblong-lanceolate. Apical part of male buds rounded in cross section. — Moluccas and Papua Barat (Bird's Head).
Leaves oblong-lanceolate. Apical part of male buds often ± triangular (sometimes not apparent). [Dry fruits 4-5.5 cm long.] — Papua New Guinea (Morobe, Northern, S Highlands Prov. & New Britain).
Leaves below seemingly glabrous, but very short and dense indumentum evident under a lens.

Leaves below glabrous, (late) glabrescent, or with small but scattered hairs only. Male buds either less than 12 mm long, or if 12 mm long then only 2-3 mm across (here also included is M. cylindrocarpa, of which the flowers are not known).
Leaves below silvery by its short cobweb-like indumentum. Older twigs rugose with coarse wart-like lenticels. Male buds ovoid-oblong, 11-12 by 5-5.5 mm. — W Papua Barat; lowland.
Indumentum rust-coloured. Older twigs not with wart-like lenticels. Flowers not known.
Petiole 2-3 cm long; base of leaf blade broadly rounded or ± cordate. — Papua New Guinea (Western Prov.); lowland.
Petiole 1.5 cm long; base of leaf blade cuneate. — Papua Barat (Jayapura Prov.); lowland.
Lower leaf surface papillose (lens!). Peduncle of inflorescence conspicuously flattened. Male buds ovoid to oblong, 6 mm long or less.
Lower leaf surface not papillose. Peduncle flattened or not. Male buds oblong-lanceolate, 6 mm long or more [Flowers not known in M. cylindrocarpa', male buds 4 mm in M. atrescens.].

Leaves oblong-lanceolate, nerves and venation faint. Male inflorescences with flattened peduncle, with sessile simple lateral flower-bearing brachyblasts; male buds 5.5 mm long or less. — Louisiade Archipelago.

Leaves ± elliptic-oblong, lateral nerves and venation ± distinct. Male inflorescence with flattened peduncle, with stalked simple or branched brachyblasts; male buds 5.5-6.5 mm long. — Most frequent in coastal area of northern Papua New Guinea, Bismarck Archipelago, E to Solomon Islands.
Leaves below glabrous, (grey-)whitish. Infructescence (inflorescence) 10 mm supra-axillary. [Flowers not known.] — Papua New Guinea (Madang Prov.); low altitude.
Leaves below grey or brown. Inflorescences up to 6 mm supra-axillary.

Leaves conspicuously greenish above. Inflorescences slender, with peduncle 3-5 cm long. Male buds 11-13 mm long; pedicel long, slender, 10-12 mm long, bracteole persistent. — Papua New Guinea (Central Prov.); lowland.
Leaves (olivaceous-)brown. Peduncle 1.5 cm long or less. Male buds shorter; bracteole persistent or caducous.
Leaves conspicuously blackish brown. Male buds 4 mm long; bracteole persistent. — SE Papua Barat; lowland.
Leaves olivaceous, brown, or dark brown. Male buds 6 mm long or more; bracteole (late) caducous.
Male buds 10 by 3 mm [inner surface smooth; pedicel 5-6 mm long.] — Local endemic in rain forest of Papua New Guinea (Central Prov.), 500-700 m (possibly also Central Papua Barat, 1300 m).
Male buds 6-9 by 1.5—2(—3) mm. — Plants from lowland or montane area
Male buds inside smooth. [Lateral nerves on lower leaf surface flat or sunken, concolorous; a species generally with sessile, non-pedunculate inflorescences.] — N & E Papua New Guinea; montane.
Male buds inside with verrucose ridges in the lower half. [Pedicel 3.5-6 mm long.] (Check also M. pumila, a species from low altitudes, usually with completely sessile inflorescences).
Twigs 2-3 mm diam. — Throughout New Guinea; montane.
Twigs 1-2 mm diam.

Nerves on lower leaf surface much contrasting in colour. Male buds 7 mm long, apex acute, verrucose ridges on inside faint; bracteole persistent. — Papua New Guinea (Central Prov., Sogeri area); c. 400 m.

Nerves less contrasting. Male buds ± blunt, 4-6 mm long, verrucose ridges distinct; bracteole caducous. — Papua New Guinea (Gulf, Central, East Sepik, and Madang Prov.); foothill and montane forest; 300-1600 m.

Lower leaf surface glabrous (or early glabrescent, or with scattered very minute pale hairs less than 0.1 mm), with distinct uniform and similarly shaped papillae (papillae may be less prominent in M. insipida and M. lancifolia).

Lower leaf surface glabrous (glabrescent), or pubescent; surface not or but faintly papillose (papillae either present but extremely small, very closely set and mutually appressed, or extremely irregular in shape and size).
Nerves making a comparatively sharp angle to the midrib, c. 45°. [Male flowers not known.] — S Central New Guinea.
Nerves with a wider angle to the midrib.

Male buds narrow, 4-4.5 mm long, with hairs 0.1 mm; pedicel about as long as the perianth or somewhat shorter; androphore glabrous. [Anthers 5 or 6. Lateral nerves on lower leaf surface faint, comparatively dense.] —New Guinea: Papua Barat (Bird's Head, N Papua Barat); Papua New Guinea (E to Madang Prov.); also Moluccas.
Male buds slender or not; pedicel considerably shorter than the perianth; androphore glabrous or pubescent in the lower half.

Twigs delicate, 1-1.5 mm diam. Lateral nerves on lower leaf surface faint, comparatively dense. Male buds ± slender, 3.5-5 mm long, 1.5-2 mm wide, with hairs 0.1 mm; androphore pubescent in the lower half; anthers 3 (or 4). — Papua New Guinea.

Twigs 1-2 mm diam. Nerves distinct below, rather far apart. Male buds ± ellipsoid-oblong, 4.5-6 mm long, 2-3 mm wide, with hairs (0.1-)0.2-0.4 mm; androphore glabrous or pubescent towards the base; anthers 6-8. [Fruits ellipsoid, 2.5-3.5(-3.8) cm long, hairs 0.3-1 mm.] — S New Guinea; also S Moluccas and N Australia.
Twigs delicate, 1-1.5 mm diam.; nerves distinct below, far apart. [Fruits 3 cm long, subsessile, hairs 0.1 mm.] — Local endemic of southern Papua New Guinea.
Leaves with c. 25 nerves per side, faint and closely set. [Male flowers not known.] — Rossel 1.
